column4: you could maybe add a sym link under /dev/dsp pointing to the other sound card but im sure there is a better solution
interesting, but how do i do that :)
you only have the usb sound card?

and if you type cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp you get no sound right?
i dont want to tell you do do something that might break sound
it says that the drive is full :/
any new ideas how i can fix this? :)
ok that is an odd message so im not going to lead you any further down that road :)
if it were regular hardware of this were solaris maybe but im not sure how ubuntu handles that usb device
okay thx anyway (C-Media Headphone Set) its the drivers..
okay but if i can listen on music and all it should work in AA also, right? :/
